name: WebSocketTransformer
comment:
The dart-io.WebSocketTransformer provides the ability to upgrade a dart-io.HttpRequest to a dart-io.WebSocket connection. It supports both upgrading a single dart-io.HttpRequest and upgrading a stream of dart-io.HttpRequests.

To upgrade a single dart-io.HttpRequest use the static dart-io.WebSocketTransformer.upgrade method.

HttpServer server;
server.listen((request) {
  if (...) {
    WebSocketTransformer.upgrade(request).then((websocket) {
      ...
    });
  } else {
    // Do normal HTTP request processing.
  }
});

To transform a stream of dart-io.HttpRequest events as it implements a stream transformer that transforms a stream of HttpRequest into a stream of WebSockets by upgrading each HttpRequest from the HTTP or HTTPS server, to the WebSocket protocol.

server.transform(new WebSocketTransformer()).listen((webSocket) => ...);

This transformer strives to implement web sockets as specified by RFC6455.

constructors.comment:
Create a new dart-io.WebSocketTransformer.

If dart-io.WebSocketTransformer.WebSocketTransformer-.protocolSelector is provided, dart-io.WebSocketTransformer.WebSocketTransformer-.protocolSelector will be called to select what protocol to use, if any were provided by the client. dart-io.WebSocketTransformer.WebSocketTransformer-.protocolSelector is should return either a dart-core.String or a dart-async.Future completing with a dart-core.String. The dart-core.String must exist in the list of protocols.

upgrade.name: upgrade
upgrade.comment:
Upgrades a dart-io.HttpRequest to a dart-io.WebSocket connection. If the request is not a valid web socket upgrade request a HTTP response with status code 500 will be returned. Otherwise the returned future will complete with the dart-io.WebSocket when the upgrade pocess is complete.

If dart-io.WebSocketTransformer.upgrade.protocolSelector is provided, dart-io.WebSocketTransformer.upgrade.protocolSelector will be called to select what protocol to use, if any were provided by the client. dart-io.WebSocketTransformer.upgrade.protocolSelector is should return either a dart-core.String or a dart-async.Future completing with a dart-core.String. The dart-core.String must exist in the list of protocols.

isUpgradeRequest.name: isUpgradeRequest
isUpgradeRequest.comment: Checks whether the request is a valid WebSocket upgrade request.

hashCode.name: hashCode
hashCode.comment:
Get a hash code for this object.

All objects have hash codes. Hash codes are guaranteed to be the same for objects that are equal when compared using the equality operator ==. Other than that there are no guarantees about the hash codes. They will not be consistent between runs and there are no distribution guarantees.

If a subclass overrides dart-io.WebSocketTransformer.hashCode it should override the equality operator as well to maintain consistency.

runtimeType.name: runtimeType
runtimeType.comment: A representation of the runtime type of the object.

==.comment:
The equality operator.

The default behavior for all dart-core.Objects is to return true if and only if this and dart-io.WebSocketTransformer.==.other are the same object.

Override this method to specify a different equality relation on a class. The overriding method must still be an equivalence relation. That is, it must be:

  • Total: It must return a boolean for all arguments. It should never throw or return null.

  • Reflexive: For all objects o, o == o must be true.

  • Symmetric: For all objects o1 and o2, o1 == o2 and o2 == o1 must either both be true, or both be false.

  • Transitive: For all objects o1, o2, and o3, if o1 == o2 and o2 == o3 are true, then o1 == o3 must be true.

The method should also be consistent over time, so equality of two objects should not change over time, or at least only change if one of the objects was modified.

If a subclass overrides the equality operator it should override the dart-io.WebSocketTransformer.hashCode method as well to maintain consistency.

toString.name: toString
toString.comment: Returns a string representation of this object.

noSuchMethod.name: noSuchMethod
noSuchMethod.comment:
dart-io.WebSocketTransformer.noSuchMethod is invoked when users invoke a non-existent method on an object. The name of the method and the arguments of the invocation are passed to dart-io.WebSocketTransformer.noSuchMethod in an dart-core.Invocation. If dart-io.WebSocketTransformer.noSuchMethod returns a value, that value becomes the result of the original invocation.

The default behavior of dart-io.WebSocketTransformer.noSuchMethod is to throw a dart-core.NoSuchMethodError.
